title: US jobless rate hits lowest since 1969 but it may be the calm before the storm
text:
The US unemployment rate has dropped to a 50-year low of 3.5pc, touching levels last seen in the glory years of the late 1960s.

It evokes the big-spending era of ‘guns and butter’ under Lyndon Johnson, when all boats were lifted by the combined fiscal stimulus of the Vietnam War and the welfare programmes of the Great Society.

Yet the differences are astonishing. That episode came in the early phases of an inflationary spiral. The economy was overheating and the Federal Reserve was having to jam on the brakes with double digit interest rates. Richard Nixon had by then taken over the White House.

This time deflation stalks the global financial system and $17 trillion of bonds are trading at negative...
description: The US unemployment rate has dropped to a 50-year low of 3.
